fields.summary: give non-admin users read-only view of Workflow conditions (not just the Workflow map)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40638].
  {panel}

When stopping JIRA using the stop-jira.sh script it calls shutdown.sh -force, which passes the -force on to catalina.sh.

We should not be passing the -force option as it does a {{kill -9}} on the process after a set timeout. 

By default we should send a {{kill -TERM}} on the process. ie. a regular {{kill <pid>}} to allow the application to do some cleanup before exiting.

h4. Workaround
Use the shutdown.sh script instead as it does not pass the -force option to catalina.sh
fields.summary: stop-jira script should not pass -force option
Add timezone +9.50 and +10.50 into JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40630].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:
h5. Scenario 1
* Shared a filter to user "danny"
!filter_1.jpg|thumbnail!
* Accessed the filter via the email received (user "danny" not logged on) and you will be redirected to an error page
!filter_5.jpg|thumbnail!
!filter_2.jpg|thumbnail!

h5. Scenario 2
* Login and copy the URL of the filter from the browser. Log out and paste it on a browser. You will be redirected to a login page.
!filter_3.jpg|thumbnail!
!filter_4.jpg|thumbnail!
!filter_6.jpg|thumbnail!

Both scenario show that the user is not logged on, yet being redirected to different pages. It would be great if this can be fixed by redirecting users to the same page regardless of the manner of accessing the filter (whether via email or copy/paste from the browser URL).
fields.summary: Inconsistent behavior when accessing a filter (user not logged on)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40629].
{panel}
*Summary*
Default post functions order causing comment added in transition screen to be denied with certain status' property:
 * *jira.permission.comment.user* set to denied/false
 * *jira.permission.work.denied* set to denied/false

*Cause*
When JIRA performing the post functions, the issue's status will get changed first before comment is added. This is causing the property to get enforced thus denying changes in the fields even it is added during transition.

*Steps to Replicate*
 # Add a workflow property at the destination step: {{jira.permission.work.denied}} value {{denied}}
 # Add a screen to the transition to the destination step above, which have the field included
 # Publish the workflow
 # Try running transition with a value in the restricted field from destination step.

*Expected Behavior*
Input during transition should be added still and only restrict after status has been change in JIRA view.

*Actual Behavior*
The workflow property is in place and causing the transition with the value to be ignored
fields.summary: Default post functions order causing values added in transition to be denied with certain status' property
KeyboardShortcut.js is using an obsolete method to detect Esc key

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40617].
  {panel}

*Behavior*
After migrating from JIRA OnDemand to JIRA v6.3.8, trying to view/edit certain workflows in _Diagram_ mode leads to a server error in the GUI.
!208199.png|thumbnail!

The following stack is found in {{catalina.out}}:
{noformat}
/rest/workflowDesigner/latest/workflows [common.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: No initial status
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: No initial status
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.workflowdesigner.layout.LayoutUpdaterImpl$Updater.getInitialStepId(LayoutUpdaterImpl.java:347)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.workflowdesigner.layout.LayoutUpdaterImpl$Updater.addedTransitions(LayoutUpdaterImpl.java:287)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.workflowdesigner.layout.LayoutUpdaterImpl$Updater.update(LayoutUpdaterImpl.java:72)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.workflowdesigner.layout.LayoutUpdaterImpl.updateLayoutWithDataFromWorkflow(LayoutUpdaterImpl.java:48)
	at com.sysbliss.jira.plugins.workflow.manager.WorkflowLayoutManagerImpl.updateLayoutWithDataFromWorkflow(WorkflowLayoutManagerImpl.java:164)
	at com.sysbliss.jira.plugins.workflow.manager.WorkflowLayoutManagerImpl.updateExistingLayout(WorkflowLayoutManagerImpl.java:142)
	at com.sysbliss.jira.plugins.workflow.manager.WorkflowLayoutManagerImpl.getExistingLayoutOrCreate(WorkflowLayoutManagerImpl.java:79)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.workflowdesigner.layout.WorkflowLayoutsImpl.getLayout(WorkflowLayoutsImpl.java:101)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.workflowdesigner.rest.WorkflowsResource.getWorkflow(WorkflowsResource.java:69)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:483)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.interceptor.impl.DispatchProviderHelper$ResponseOutInvoker$1.invoke(DispatchProviderHelper.java:234)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.interceptor.impl.DispatchProviderHelper$1.intercept(DispatchProviderHelper.java:100)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.interceptor.impl.DefaultMethodInvocation.invoke(DefaultMethodInvocation.java:61)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.expand.interceptor.ExpandInterceptor.intercept(ExpandInterceptor.java:38)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.interceptor.impl.DefaultMethodInvocation.invoke(DefaultMethodInvocation.java:61)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.interceptor.impl.DispatchProviderHelper.invokeMethodWithInterceptors(DispatchProviderHelper.java:132)
	at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.interceptor.impl.DispatchProviderHelper$ResponseOutInvoker._dispatch(DispatchProviderHelper.java:230)
	at com.sun.jersey.server.impl.model.method.dispatch.ResourceJavaMethodDispatcher.dispatch(ResourceJavaMethodDispatcher.java:75)
{noformat}

This issue was reproduced locally using a customer XML backup.

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Migrate from JIRA OnDemand to JIRA v6.3.8 Server
# Try to view/edit workflows as _Diagram_

*Workaround*
# Export problematic workflow as XML
# Import the same XML back into JIRA
# Navigate to {{Administration >> Issues >> Workflow Schemes}} to re-assign issue types to imported workflow

When utilizing this workaround, the only changes that are occurring to the workflow itself are the author and creation date - this can be verified by comparing XML exports of the same workflow pre- and post-import - but the imported workflow is available to view/edit as a diagram at {{Administration >> Issues >> Workflows}}.
fields.summary: Migrating from OnDemand to JIRA 6.3.8 Server Breaks Workflow Diagrams

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40578].
  {panel}

h3. Step To Reproduce
Create an issue, and upload attachment
Hover over the relative time for the attachment

h3. Expected Results
An exact timestamp is shown after hovering the relative time

h3. Actual Results
No exact timestamp is shown.

This feature works on other relative timestamps such as Dates but doesn't work for attachments.

h3. Work Around
Turn off Relative Time and display exact time for all date fields
- shut down JIRA
- edit <JIRA_HOME>/JIRA/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/jpm.xml
- find the setting for jira.lf.date.relativize
- set this to false
- start JIRA back up
fields.summary: Relative Time on Attachment Doesn't Display Exact Time on Hover
Use diferent e-mail setting for a user on LDAP directory.
User signup form and moderation
Fetch the window.location at form display and not at page load
Created vs Resolved Chart should show real cumulative values

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40571].
  {panel}

As mentioned in JRA-39411
* Anonymous users are able to create issues 
* Deactivated users are not treated as anonymous. They won't be able to create issues

However, there are no warning messages that deactivated users cannot create tickets. It would be better if there is a warning message so the administrators or the user itself is aware of it. Otherwise, the emails will just be ignored and neither the admin nor the user will be aware that potentially important emails are being ignored.

While JRA-39411 is about treating deactivated users as anonymous, this is about a warning message that deactivated users cannot create tickets via email.
fields.summary: Warning message that deactivated Users cannot create Tickets via email

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

It seems that the below tutorial would need to be reviewed:
- [Plugin Tutorial - Writing custom importer using JIRA Importers Plugin|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/Plugin%20Tutorial%20-%20Writing%20custom%20importer%20using%20JIRA%20Importers%20Plugin]

I have followed the steps that is instructed in the tutorial and the import will fail. The condition is that when the CSV import is to a project with Software Development Template including the workflow it will throws errors, screenshot and logs below.
!customimport.PNG|thumbnail!
In {{atlassian-jira.log}} shows:
{noformat}
2014-10-23 18:06:45,760 JiraTaskExectionThread-1 INFO admin 1086x4387x1 6q8ey2 10.60.2.192 /secure/admin/ImporterLogsPage!import.jspa [imports.importer.impl.AbstractDataImporter$1Thread[http-bio-2990-exec-10,5,main]] Created Priority : priority with id 6
2014-10-23 18:06:45,847 JiraTaskExectionThread-1 ERROR admin 1086x4387x1 6q8ey2 10.60.2.192 /secure/admin/ImporterLogsPage!import.jspa [imports.importer.impl.AbstractDataImporter$1Thread[http-bio-2990-exec-10,5,main]] Error importing issue ExternalIssue{externalId=issueId, summary=summary, issueType=1}
com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.external.ExternalException: Unable to create issue: summary
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.ExternalUtils.createIssue(ExternalUtils.java:194)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.DefaultJiraDataImporter.createIssue(DefaultJiraDataImporter.java:896)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.DefaultJiraDataImporter.importIssues(DefaultJiraDataImporter.java:764)
	....
Caused by: com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.external.ExternalException: Status 'Open' does not have a linked step in the 'CSV: Software Development Workflow' workflow. Please map to a different status.
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.ExternalUtils.checkStatus(ExternalUtils.java:209)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.ExternalUtils.createIssue(ExternalUtils.java:183)
	... 35 more
{noformat}
In addition, by download the branches from the provided link to get the source also fails.

*Notes:*
By selecting to create a new project that uses the default workflow will get the CSV import possible. All the information from the CSV file will be imported as an issue.
fields.summary: Update and Review for JIRA Custom CSV Importer Tutorial

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40553].
  {panel}

There are no hints on ajax actions in progress. This is very confusing when action takes more than 1-2 seconds.

For example:
# Go to Issue navigator, select filter in the left column, stare at screen wondering if anything is going on, stare a bit more, start worrying, click randomly around, check internet connection, boom! see results
# Now open first issue, click next, stare at screen wondering if anything is going on, boom! see the next issue.

There should always be a visual hint on ajax action in progress. Maybe it's possible to show this only if action takes more than a second to complete.
fields.summary: Add hints on ajax actions in progress

Create branch - branch name template

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40548].
  {panel}

I found a bug within the rest API while we were testing our interface to JIRA, fetching issues from JIRA. 

After creating an issue with 5000 'ä' we get a python error on our side:

UnicodeDecodeError: 'utf8' codec can't decode bytes in position 8197-8198: invalid data

Usually this means encoding is set wrong, but in this case, JIRA sends wrong UTF8 Data. 

\xc3\xa4 stands for 'ä' in the utf-8 encoding tab. After 3779 of \xc3\xa4 JIRA adds some extra bytes '\r\nb2c\r\n'.This cuts through the byte of \xc3 and \xa4 making the data unreadable causing the decode error.

Problem does not exist with 3000 'ä'
fields.summary: Rest API: Wrong UTF8 Data

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

!sss2.png!

In the past (one week ago) the date and time were there, visible, right above each comment/bounce/update

Quick access to date and time are very important for code reviews and ticket handling. 

Can we have this back?

h3. Current behaviour

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40541].
  {panel}

If your Activity stream has a limit of 10 entries and you add a filter (for Example, 'Issue Created') the filtered list will not be 10 entries. Instead it will only display the X items in the list of 10 that match the filter.

*Example:*
Activity Stream has a limit of 5 items displayed at once:
Event type is Issue Created
The 4 most recent actions are comments
Only 1 item is shown in the Activity Stream.

For clarity, it should display 10 items of the desired type. As this can confuse users are they will see 'no activity' when if their last event has been pushed off by other non-visible events.
fields.summary: Activity Stream should take filter into account for Item Display Limit

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

h3. Summary
The order of transition buttons did not display as per configured {{opsbar-sequence}}

h3. Expected Results
Order of the transition buttons are displayed as per configured

h3. Actual Results
Transition buttons are ordered randomly

Refresh the page, and transition buttons will be displayed properly

h5. Testing notes
Details of Test Heuristics can be found at http://go/stopsu 

*Stress*

*Time* 
* Paste multiple times (hold the button down)

*Operations* 
* N/A

*Platform* 
* IE 9-11, Firefox, Safari, Chrome

*Security* 
* N/A

*Usability* 
* Should not render empty/extra space in the header area
* Should not display content out of position after pasting (IE11)

*Other*
* Java dialog should be presented only for IE10 and below

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40528].
  {panel}

When using the Activity Stream gadget there are currently only 4 filter options:
Project
JIRA Issue Key
Update Date
Username

It would be extremely useful to be able to filter any combination of categories or actions including resolution, Workflow Transitions, time logged, etc. 

Another approach would be to allow users to create a search filter & then to stream either general or specific activity on tickets falling under that search filter.

Additionally, the constraint of Display Options > Limit to XX Items is overly rigid. Would be very useful to be able to constrain to a time period, ie. 8 hours, 1 week, etc. up to a configurable max number of items.

EX:
Activity stream showing every time a user in the CS Group transitioned a ticket from "Resolved" to "In QA" over the past 24 hours. Show 20 Results + link to full list.

EX: 
Activity stream showing every time CurrentUser() commented a ticket forever. Show 5 results + link to full list.
fields.summary: Activity Stream should have more filter options
Minimize or maximize the subtasks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40522].
  {panel}

h3. ***Current Behaviour***
It is possible to set the the recipients of notifications to 
- Current Assignee
- Reporter
- Current User
- Project Lead
- Component Lead
- Single User
- Group
- Project Role
- Single Email Address
- All Watchers
- User Custom Field Value
- Group Custom Field Value

h3. ***Feature Request***
It would be great to add an additional condition as such the notification is sent to certain individuals from the project roles.

bq. For example, we would like to have the option to send the Issue Created notification, not to ALL Current Assignees, but only to one/few users that I would specifically select to be notified on that event.

Additional condition to notify a specific group the Reporter belongs too
fields.summary: Additional Conditions For Notification Schemes
Permission Helper requires an existing issue to verify Create Issue permission
Ability to set resolution field due smart commit #resolve

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40519].
  {panel}

When someone does a "re-assign" or an initial assign, it is often desirable to perform actions based on the "re-assign".

One idea would be to allow for "generic" transactions per "workflow scheme".
- assign would be such a "generic" transaction and could have the same three attributes as a standard state transition:
- condition (if false hide the "Assign" button, example - you could only allow "Assign" if state IN "Open, Re-Opened) ...)
- validator (could check if fields are filled, ...)
- post-action (could force the issue to go back to "Open" state)

Edit could be handled in a similar fashion. I have seen support requests and bug reports that requested this.

Every workflow could specify the attributes that apply to workflow transitions for specific "transactions" that do not constitute a "state transition"
fields.summary: The "Assign" action should have similar properties like a state transition
JIRA's feedback modal dialog is too small and cuts off content
Update 6.3 Stable to bundle Service Desk 2.0.3
JIRA user server should not be able to be created via REST in OnDemand/Cloud

Assignable Watcher and Reporter permissions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40502].
  {panel}

At present, you are only able to configure the starting date of the Created vs. Resolved chart by setting a value for number of days previously.  While this is generally helpful, I find myself having to frequently update the gadget to display the desired timeline.  It also includes all issue types, whereas I have a need to understand how many Defects are incoming versus New Features.

Request:  As a project manager, I would like to be able to set a start date for the chart in the gadget configuration OR use the existing number of days prior configuration.

Use Case:  Our projects often have continuous testing, and I would like to be able to have a chart that shows the created/resolved defects based on the start date of a of testing for that particular project or Sprint.  To accomplish this, I would need to be able to only view created/resolved defects beginning from a defined date, not a floating date.

The ability to have that kind of quality view across multiple sprints for a given version is immensely valuable.  One of the key things I want to be able to see is the point at which the resolved tickets surpass the created tickets.  At that point I begin to have confidence that we're trending towards our completion date.  If we're halfway through our schedule for the version, and our created defects are still outpacing our resolved defects, I know I have a serious quality problem to address.
fields.summary: Allow additional configurations of the Created vs. Resolved chart (Start Date and Issue Type)
Time Tracking Report: Enabling option to choose Sprint instead of Fix Version
Searching for Created/Updated/etc Date is not intuitive

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40493].
  {panel}

h3. Problem
Editing a filter with assignee whose username is in capital letters disable the Basic search mode.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a user with username in capital letters (for example, MEL), assign an issue to this user.
# Create a filter in Basic search mode, select assignee with any user.
# Save the filter.
# Open the filter and edit it by changing the assignee to the user created in step 1.
# Save the filter.

h3. Expected result
When open the filter again, the filter will be available in Basic mode.

h3. Actual result
The filter is only available in Advanced mode which the button for Basic mode is greyed out.
fields.summary: Usernames with capital letters force the Advanced filter mode
Jira Should support MongoDB
Increase User/Group Object Filter Text Box Size

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40486].
  {panel}

In Projet Issue View, all provided links are based on generic concept and predefined filters (in system-preset-filters-sections.xml), and their translation causes 

All these filters refer about list of issues following different filters, and may return between 0 to n issues.
In French, "Issue" is translated "Demande" which is feminine name, and adjectives have to agree in gender and number.

Then for all i18n key work based on an adjective, English has no need to make a difference between singular and plural, but not in French. I will not try to explain in English special rule related the usage of verb "Avoir" (to have) and "Etre" (To be), but it has also an impact on how we write adjectives.

By exemple, i18n key like "common.filters.<adjective>" should be translated with plural and feminine
{code}
common.filters.addedrecently=Ajout\u00E9es r\u00E9cemment
common.filters.updatedrecently=Mises \u00E0 jour r\u00E9cemment
common.filters.assignedtome=Qui me sont attribu\u00E9es

common.filters.reportedbyme=Que j''ai rapport\u00E9s
common.filters.unscheduled=Non planifi\u00E9es
{code}

Some other is correclty translated :
{code}
common.filters.resolvedrecently=R\u00E9solues r\u00E9cemment
{code}

And "common.filters.outstanding" has been translated "Unresolved" like "common.concepts.unresolved", but due to the associated filters, where only the order differs, we shoud have a better translation ...

The term "outstanding" has many possible French translation in google (https://translate.google.com/#auto/fr/outstanding), but none of them express the order on Update Date.  
And same remark for the translation of "common.concepts.unresolved" ... the order of the filter is not visible in the translation.

What is sure, is that these both translation should not be the same.

My proposal would be 

{code}
common.filters.outstanding=Non r\u00E9solues et mises \u00E0 jour r\u00E9cemment
common.concepts.unresolved=Non r\u00E9solues par priorit00E9s
{code}

Except these 2 last key words,the other corrections have been also proposed in https://translations.atlassian.com .

Regards
Vincent
fields.summary: Some French corrections in Project Issue View

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40485].

Environment Tested: JIRA 6.3.6
Browser : Chrome, Firefox, IE

Steps to reproduce:
# create 2 issues . eg: TEST-1 and TEST-2
# in one of the issue, link another issue . Eg: link issue TEST-1 to TEST-2 in the issue description
# in Issue Navigator, use List View
# search for issues . Eg: 
!IssueNavigator.png|thumbnail!
# access one of the issue and click the link for another issue. Eg: 
!FE2.png|thumbnail!
# it open another issue. Eg: browser open up TEST-1
# then, click Back on the web browser
# (BUG) The URL indicate the TEST-2 when the issue is still showing TEST-1
!Bug.png|thumbnail!
# expected behaviour, when user click on Back on browser, it should navigate back to issue TEST-2

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40483].
  {panel}

h3. Current behaviour

When you tag an user in a comment or any text box in JIRA with the "@" symbol, the mail notification is sent with the mail from the user who commented and tagged the other user.

h3. Expected behaviour

Send the notification through the same email that is registered as the notification mail for JIRA.
fields.summary: Send mail through JIRA's notification mail instead of user mail when tagging someone

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40481].
  {panel}

Quote from user:
----
The "Create Issue" dialog has very small and narrow text box for the actual issue description. In many cases it is really hard to write a lengthy bug request due the limited text size (see attachment).
It would be very helpful to increase the width of this "Create" layer from currently 800 pixel to 1000 and for the "Description" field from 500 to 700.
Also it would be helpful to increase (double) the text field height from 200 pixel to 400.
If this are relative values, so it would be helpful to increase the appropriate relative values instead (I'm not insisting on absolute pixel count).
----
fields.summary: Our users think that too much screen real estate is wasted during creation of issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40477].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently if you forward a mail as an attachment, for example using Microsoft Outlook or Thunderbird, it shows up in a JIRA issue as a file with no extension containing a MIME formatted file containing xhtml with MS Office's extensions. Because there is no extension, clicking on the file does not open it in the appropriate way.

h3. Suggested Solution

Adding a check to rename such a file to be called .eml or .msg would give the necessary hint required for a mail program to successfully open such an attachment.

h3. Cause

Attaching an email in a client such as gmail will provide a filename for the attachment, for example:

{noformat}
Content-Type: message/rfc822; name="test.eml"
Content-Disposition: attachment; filename="test.eml"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: base64
...
{noformat}

Attaching an email in Outlook provides no name or filename for the attachment:

{noformat}
Content-type: message/rfc822
Content-disposition: attachment
{noformat}

As a result JIRA doesn't know what to name this file.
 
h3. Workaround 
* This has previously been suggested and implemented in JEMH as per [https://thepluginpeople.atlassian.net/browse/JEMH-1376], so seems like it's possible to do this.
* Remove the *"In-Reply-To:"* header mail
fields.summary: Allow forwarded email attachments to be detected by JIRA mail handler and renamed to .eml or .msg
Things shifting around in the Activity tabs
Visual bug: 'send notification' checkbox label in edit labels dialog doesn't align with checkbox

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40464].
  {panel}

Currently, it takes a lots of effort to import a project from Cloud to JIRA server. The admin would need to do the following:
# Backup from Cloud
# Restore to JIRA Server A
# Backup and project import in JIRA Server B

It would be great if we can have the enhance the current project import feature to directly extract the project from OnDemand XML backup. This would reduce the effort from users and improve the experience of project import.
fields.summary: Support project import from Cloud to JIRA Server

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40458].
  {panel}

If the 'Log Work' field is present in a Transition and information is added, this information is not directly indexed and thus does not display in List View of the Issue Navigator.

If you log work on an issue without during a transition it will be properly updated.

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Create a new project (ex. Simple issue tracking)
# Add a Screen to one of the transitions
# Add the 'log work' field to this transition
# Create an Example issue
# Transition this issue and enter 4h for the time spent
# Go to search and find this issue. 
# Make sure you're in list view and 'Time Spent' column is displayed

Result: No work is displayed in the 'Time Spent' column.
Adding a work log again (ie 5 minutes) will update the index correctly and it will now show 4h5m.

*Workaround*
Log work outside of Transitions.
A background re-index will properly show all the columns.
fields.summary: Work logged during a transition is not indexed and is not displayed in issue search
The "CompleteSprint" button is brutally difficult to find

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40456].
  {panel}

Hi,

When you share a jira with multiple users, an individual email is sent to each person. Is there any way to have an email send that essentially cc's everyone in the one email. i.e.: One email is sent to all users so once the email is received, user A can see that user B, user C and user D also received the mail. User A can therefore include all users on a reply.

it would be good to have this as an option when sending JIRAs.

Thanks
Louise
fields.summary: Option to share email with multiple users
Providing User Authentication for Gadgets
Group Ownership a shared filters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40453].
  {panel}

h3. Current Behaviour
User who are not member of the JIRA Users Global Permission will not have the permission to create a dashboard. JIRA System Administrator and JIRA Administrators can't  create dashboard without adding them to JIRA Users Global Permission. The users without the JIRA Users Global permission will be redirected to the login page despite they have already logged in.

h3. Expected Behaviour
There should not be a permission to create a dashboard. If the permission is really required, it should throws error saying *Permission JIRA User is required to create Dashboard* rather than redirecting the user to the login page without having any further information. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
1. Remove a user from the JIRA Users Global Permission 
2. Go to create Dashboard
3. Redirected to a login page without error message, username and password will not work if the user is not in the JIRA User's global permission

h3.Workaround
Add the user to the JIRA Users Global Permission
fields.summary: Avoid the need to have to "JIRA Users Global Permission" in order to create a Dashboard

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-40452].
  {panel}

Hello Attassian

I wanted to write this issue since a long time ago. Now, in my organization (canope, france) we have a license for 500 users. I have to say you, the functions provide by jira to sort user are not very convenient when the number of users increase. At least, we need a simple function to sort user by activity (last connexion for example). it would be another criteria in user search function. 

I found the two solutions below but... the first is not convenient and the second (even if i understand the policy to promote plugin development) is not acceptable. Sort user by activity is a trivial function to manage all the accounts, specially when the panel of users increase. In my point of view this function is missing. 

https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/93421/jira-admin-sort-users-list-by-directory?utm_source=SAC&utm_medium=dashboard

https://support.atlassian.com/customer/search?q=sort+user


that's all. Thank you very much Atlassian 

Jérôme Martin
